Yes, Encompass recognizes that many immigrants and refugees experience trauma, stress, and mental health challenges related to their immigration experience. As a result, Encompass provides several mental health services to support individuals and families within these communities. 

1. Trauma-Informed Care – Encompass provides trauma-informed care across its services to address the specific needs of immigrant and refugee communities who may be dealing with trauma related to their migration experience. The organization understands that trauma can be ongoing and that it can affect different people differently. For this reason, Encompass supports community-driven trauma-informed care to address the individuals' specific needs and help them build resilience.

2. Individual and Family Therapy – Encompass provides individual and family therapy services for individuals and families dealing with complex trauma related to their immigration experience. The therapy aims to help individuals and families heal from their trauma and adjust to life in a new country. 

3. Mental Health Counseling – Encompass provides mental health counseling for immigrant and refugee communities, focusing on addressing the effects of trauma and other mental health challenges related to migration. 

4. Support Groups – Encompass offers support groups for individuals and families to share their experiences, build connections, and access resources that support mental wellness. 

By providing these services, Encompass aims to help individuals and families within immigrant and refugee communities address mental health challenges related to their immigration journey. Encompass recognizes that by addressing these challenges, individuals and families can better adjust to life in a new country, improve their quality of life, and rebuild their sense of community and belonging.
